Authors: Keivan Safikhani, Ziba Jamzad, Hojjatollah Saeidi
Title:
Phylogenetic Relationships in Iranian Scutellaria L.
(Lamiaceae) Based on Nuclear Ribosomal ITS and Chloroplast trnL-F DNA
Data
Keywords:
Iran, ITS, Lamiaceae, Molecular phylogeny, Scutellaria,
trnL-F
Abstract:
The genus Scutellaria (Lamiaceae, Scutellarioidae)
includes taxa with a wide range of pharmacological traits which make
this genus economically important. Previous taxonomical studies on
Scutellaria were mainly based on morphological and chromosomal
characters. The infra-generic classification of the genus has been the
subject of a long controversy among authors and delimitation of taxa was
has been problematic. In this study we did a phylogenetic analysis on
the genus with a focus on Iranian taxa belonging to subgenera
Apeltanthus and Scutellaria. The sequences of internal transcribed
spacer (ITS) region of the nuclear ribosomal DNA (nrDNA) and trnL-F
region of chloroplast DNA (cpDNA) were used to analyze phylogenetic
relationships among 42 taxa. Our results showed that in both ITS and
trnL-F trees, there are two main clades within the genus corresponding
to the two subgenera including subg. Scutellaria and subg. Apeltanthus.
In the subg. Scutellaria, the sect. Anaspis is monophyletic but the
monophyly of section Scutellaria is not confirmed. In this subgenus, S.
galericulata has an isolated position in both trees which suggests its
independence from sect. Scutellaria and being recognized in sect.
Galericularia as was considered before by some authors. In subg.
Apeltanthus sect. Apeltanthus and sect. Lupulinaria are not
monophyletic, furthermore, the monophyly of subsect. Lupulinaria is not
supported. Our results suggest a reconsideration of sectional
classification in both subgenera Apeltanthus and Scutellaria. It is
necessary to do a comprehensive sampling of taxa from different sections
in the two subgenera to be able to provide data for a new sectional
classification in the genus.
